abstract.p: New York Mets Manager Bobby Valentine implies that dirt in front of home plate in Game 1 of World Series was deliberately softened (S)

block.p: In his pregame news conference yesterday, Manager Bobby Valentine of the Mets implied that the dirt in front of home plate in Saturday's game was deliberately softened and resulted in a slowing of Timo Perez's ninth-inning grounder. Catcher Todd Pratt, the runner on third base, did not break for home and never scored.
Not so subtly, Valentine suggested the Yankees watered down the home plate area because Andy Pettitte, a ground ball pitcher, started the game.

Manager Joe Torre of the Yankees did not buy the theory. ''I know one thing,'' he said. ''I think a lot of it has to do with the weather. The Dodgers used to do that. That's probably why he's mentioning it. We don't try to do anything different.''
